result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie J Meisegeier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charlie J Meisegeier in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 15CM104.  Agreement reached in these matters.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
15CM59-DE will enter a plea of NC, court accepts and finds DE guilty.  Enhancers will be dismissed.  DE will pay a fine of $50.00/CC.  PP of $25.00 per month commencing 5-01-16

15CM104-CT's 1,2,4,5 will be DRI.  De will enter a plea of NC to Ct 3.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  DE will serve 10 days jail, fine of $1379.00, 12 month revocation of DL, 12 month IID, revocation retro to Admin suspension, 50% reduction in cost/install of IID, will be allowed huber if employed, 60 days to report to jail, 4 days credit, AODA assessment.  PP of $25.00 per month along with 15CM59.
